name: endemically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is endemic (= regularly found and very common among a particular group or in a particular area): She suggests the country's government is endemically corrupt.
More examplesFewer examplesThis will not solve the problems endemically rooted in the system.This social model, he said, was dysfunctional and endemically inefficient.They depicted the whole system as endemically evil.He sees the world as an endemically cruel place.She defended a police service which has been denounced as endemically racist.
